article_node.title: Quick-moving wildfire scorches historic California gold mining town, burning multiple homes
article_node.summary: A lightning‑ignited wildfire, the 6‑5 Fire, rapidly expanded to 6.25 square miles in California’s historic Chinese Camp Town, forcing evacuations and burning at least five homes, an RV, and surrounding structures. CalFire called for additional resources, including engines, dozers, and aircraft, as the blaze remained uncontained. The fire is part of a broader wave of over a dozen California fires that erupted that Tuesday, highlighting the state’s ongoing wildfire risk amid dry, hot conditions.
